message_1: Find all the quadratic residues modulo 11.
message_2:
A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. To find all the quadratic residues modulo 11, we need to find the squares of the integers from 0 to 10 (since 11 is a prime number) and then reduce them modulo 11.

0² ≡ 0 (mod 11)
1² ≡ 1 (mod 11)
2² ≡ 4 (mod 11)
3² ≡ 9 (mod 11)
4² ≡ 16 ≡ 5 (mod 11)
5² ≡ 25 ≡ 3 (mod 11)
6² ≡ 36 ≡ 3 (mod 11)
7² ≡ 49 ≡ 5 (mod 11)
8² ≡ 64 ≡ 9 (mod 11)
9² ≡ 81 ≡ 4 (mod 11)
10² ≡ 100 ≡ 1 (mod 11)

Now, we can list the distinct quadratic residues modulo 11: {0, 1, 3, 4, 5, 9}.
